CLEVERLEY DONE Watford sign Tom Cleverley from Everton on five-year deal starting from next season 
The midfielder, 27, joined the Hornets on loan in January and has made eight appearances for the Premier League side By Alec Shilton 31st March 2017, 12:22 pm Updated: 31st March 2017, 12:55 pm Comments WATFORD have confirmed the signing of Everton midfielder Tom Cleverley on five-year deal from next season. 
The 27-year-old midfielder joined the Hornets on loan in January and has made eight appearances for the Premier League side. Rex Features 5 Tom Cleverley has signed for Watford on a five-year deal 
Reports last week claimed that the 13-cap England international was a game away from triggering a permanent move from the Toffees. 
Keep up to date with all the latest news, gossip, rumours and done deals in SunSport’s live transfer blog 
And Watford have confirmed Cleverley’s signing ahead of his anticipated start in their midfield for the clash with Sunderland tomorrow. 
The former Manchester United man is in his second spell at Vicarage Road, having contributed two assists to steer the 14th-placed club seven points clear of the relegation battle. Rex Features Cleverley in action during his last appearance for Watford against Crystal Palace Rex Features 5 Hornets boss Walter Mazzarri has made a signing for next season already 
Morgan Schneiderlin arrived at Goodison Park from United £22 million in January which led to Cleverley’s departure. 
The former Aston Villa loanee arrived at Everton on a free at the beginning of last season.
